devdoc.details: These functions are expected to be embedded in multicalls to allow EOAs to approve a contract and call a function that requires an approval in a single transaction.

selfPermit(address,uint256,uint256,uint8.details: The `owner` is always msg.sender and the `spender` is always address(this).

params.deadline: A timestamp, the current blocktime must be less than or equal to this timestamp
params.r: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `v` and `s`
params.s: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `v`
params.token: The address of the token spent
params.v: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `s`
params.value: The amount that can be spent of token

selfPermitAllowed(address,uint256,uint25.details: The `owner` is always msg.sender and the `spender` is always address(this)

params.expiry: The timestamp at which the permit is no longer valid
params.nonce: The current nonce of the owner
params.r: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `v` and `s`
params.s: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `v`
params.token: The address of the token spent
params.v: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `s`

selfPermitAllowedIfNecessary(address,uin.details: The `owner` is always msg.sender and the `spender` is always address(this) Can be used instead of #selfPermitAllowed to prevent calls from failing due to a frontrun of a call to #selfPermitAllowed.

params.expiry: The timestamp at which the permit is no longer valid
params.nonce: The current nonce of the owner
params.r: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `v` and `s`
params.s: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `v`
params.token: The address of the token spent
params.v: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `s`

selfPermitIfNecessary(address,uint256,ui.details: The `owner` is always msg.sender and the `spender` is always address(this). Can be used instead of #selfPermit to prevent calls from failing due to a frontrun of a call to #selfPermit

params.deadline: A timestamp, the current blocktime must be less than or equal to this timestamp
params.r: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `v` and `s`
params.s: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `v`
params.token: The address of the token spent
params.v: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `s`
params.value: The amount that can be spent of token

devdoc.title: Self Permit

selfPermit(address,uint256,uint256,uint8.notice: Permits this contract to spend a given token from `msg.sender`

selfPermitAllowed(address,uint256,uint25.notice: Permits this contract to spend the sender's tokens for permit signatures that have the `allowed` parameter

selfPermitAllowedIfNecessary(address,uin.notice: Permits this contract to spend the sender's tokens for permit signatures that have the `allowed` parameter

selfPermitIfNecessary(address,uint256,ui.notice: Permits this contract to spend a given token from `msg.sender`

userdoc.notice: Functionality to call permit on any EIP-2612-compliant token for use in the route
